intro: Conyza naudinii, commonly known as the white cudweed, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Conyza naudinii is also known for its ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
